summary: Joseph S. Piccolo was a CIA employee, as evidenced by documents detailing his cover debriefing upon resignation in 1961, the cancellation of his military cover backstop in 1963, and personnel actions throughout his career. He held the position of Operations Officer and was reassigned from Managua, Nicaragua, to JMCOBRA in 1968. His official personnel folder contains information regarding promotions, reassignments, and a notice of an official disability claim file. The documents suggest a career involving overseas operations and cover assignments.
significance: The documents suggest Joseph S. Piccolo was a CIA employee involved in overseas operations. Without further context, his significance to the JFK assassination is unclear, but his role as an Operations Officer and his association with JMCOBRA might warrant further investigation depending on the context of the JFK assassination investigation.
